item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Beyond Meat 与债券持有人商讨资产负债表重组事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，Beyond Meat 已与一群债券持有人接触，开始讨论资产负债表重组事宜。【原文：Beyond Meat has engaged with a group of bondholders to initiate discussions about a balance-sheet restructuring, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 管道运营商金德摩根第二季度业绩不及预期
item.description: 美国输油管道和码头运营商金德摩根公司（Kinder Morgan）周三公布的第二季度利润和收入不及华尔街预期，受成本上升和二氧化碳业务疲软的影响。【原文：U.S. pipeline and terminal operator Kinder Morgan on Wednesday missed Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit and revenue, weighed down by higher costs and weakness in its CO2 segment.】

item.title: 美国联合航空公司第三季度利润前景令人失望，全行业面临折扣压力
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines Holdings）周三预计，由于国内市场座位数过剩，削弱了航空公司的定价能力，该公司本季度的利润将低于预期。【原文：United Airlines Holdings on Wednesday forecast lower-than-expected profit in the current quarter as the industry grapples with excess seat capacity in the domestic market, which has undermined airlines' pricing power.】

item.title: 真人秀放缓推动好莱坞制作下滑
item.description: 周三公布的统计数据显示，随着好莱坞努力从去年的双重罢工中恢复过来，洛杉矶的真人秀节目制作量大幅下降。【原文：Los Angeles experienced a hefty decline in reality TV production as Hollywood worked to recover from dual labor strikes last year, according to statistics released on Wednesday.】

item.title: 前高盛、Blackstone 分析师因内幕交易被判处 28 个月监禁
item.description: 周三，一名前高盛和黑石分析师因内幕交易罪被判处 28 个月监禁，他承认自己的行为 "愚蠢至极"。【原文：A former Goldman Sachs and Blackstone analyst was sentenced to 28 months in prison on Wednesday for insider trading, after admitting that his conduct was "catastrophically stupid."】

item.title: 美联储调查显示，最近几周更多美国联储地区经济活动出现回落
item.description: 5 月底至 7 月初，美国经济活动略有小幅扩张，企业报告称，有迹象表明就业市场继续疲软，这凸显了美联储最近转向更加敏锐地评估放缓的劳动力需求，以确保在降息之前不会等待太久。【原文：U.S. economic activity expanded at a slight to modest pace from late May through early July and firms reported some signs that the jobs market continues to soften, underscoring the Federal Reserve's recent pivot to more keenly assessing slowing demand for labor to ensure it doesn't wait too long before cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 美国银行监管机构警告各州针对银行的法律 "令人担忧
item.description: 一位美国最高银行监管机构周三警告说，该机构可能会开始反击 "令人担忧的趋势"，即各州以政治理由通过旨在监管国家银行活动的法律。【原文：A top U.S. bank regulator warned on Wednesday the agency may begin pushing back against the "worrisome trend" of states adopting laws meant to police national bank activities on political grounds.】

item.title: NTSB 将在 8 月 6-7 日的调查听证会上调查 FAA 对波音公司的监督情况
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会周三表示，已安排在两天内举行 20 个小时的听证会，讨论 1 月份阿拉斯加航空公司波音 737 MAX 9 机上舱门堵塞紧急事件。【原文：The National Transportation Safety Board said on Wednesday it had scheduled 20 hours of hearings over two days on the January Alaska Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 9 in-flight door plug emergency.】

item.title: 俄罗斯权衡采用加密货币进行国际支付的风险
item.description: 在议会就数字资产立法进行投票之前，俄罗斯反洗钱监督机构周三表示，俄罗斯应加快建立加密货币支付基础设施，但要仔细权衡相关风险。【原文：Russia should accelerate the creation of infrastructure for payments in cryptocurrencies but carefully weigh the associated risks, its money laundering watchdog said on Wednesday, ahead of a parliamentary vote on digital assets legislation.】

item.title: 欧盟反垄断监管机构希望了解谷歌和三星的聊天机器人交易是否妨碍了竞争对手
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份欧盟文件，欧盟反垄断监管机构正在询问行业参与者，谷歌与三星的多年人工智能（AI）交易是否会阻碍竞争对手在三星智能手机上使用聊天机器人。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are asking industry participants if Google's multi-year generative artificial intelligence (AI) deal with Samsung hinders rival chatbots on Samsung smartphones, according to an EU document seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，Apax、贝恩和 CVC 正在探索收购 SoftwareOne 的可能性
item.description: 在瑞士软件公司董事会下台三个月后，两位知情人士透露，Apax Partners、贝恩资本和 CVC 正在分别探讨收购 SoftwareOne 的可能性。【原文：Apax Partners, Bain Capital and CVC are each exploring potential bids for SoftwareOne , two people with knowledge of the situation said, three months after the ouster of the Swiss software company's board.】

item.title: 美国银行存款成本高企，投资银行业务受到提振
item.description: 美国贷款机构第二季度的利润受到贷款需求减少以及为留住存款而支付的高额利息的挤压，但债券的大量销售提振了其投资银行部门。【原文：U.S. lenders' second-quarter profits were squeezed by dampening loan demand and the high interest they paid to hold on to deposits, but a flurry of bond sales boosted their investment banking units.】

item.title: 美国 6 月制造业产出超预期增长 0.4
item.description: 尽管较高的借贷成本仍制约着制造业的发展，但美国工厂 6 月份的生产增幅超过预期，从而推动了第二季度产出的稳健反弹。【原文：Production at U.S. factories increased more than expected in June, contributing to a solid rebound in output in the second quarter, though higher borrowing costs remain a constraint for the manufacturing industry.】

item.title: Adobe 称亚马逊 Prime Day 活动首日美国网络销售额达 72 亿美元
item.description: Adobe Analytics 周三发布的一份报告显示，在美国亚马逊 "Prime Day "活动的第一天，购物者在各零售商处的在线消费额约为 72 亿美元。【原文：Shoppers spent about $7.2 billion online across retailers during the first day of Amazon's Prime Day in the United States, according to a report from Adobe Analytics on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔称降息时机 "日益临近
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周三表示，美国央行降息的时间 "正在临近"，但经济走势的不确定性使得降低短期借贷成本的时机尚不明确。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said on Wednesday the time for a U.S. central bank interest rate cut "is drawing closer," but uncertainty about the path of the economy makes it unclear when a lowering in the cost of short-term borrowing might happen.】

item.title: 据《信息报》报道，谷歌和微软向中国公司提供英伟达芯片
item.description: 据《信息》周三报道，谷歌和微软的云计算部门正在向中国公司提供英伟达（Nvidia）人工智能芯片，在中国以外的地方提供数据中心服务。【原文：Google and Microsoft's cloud divisions are offering Chinese companies access to Nvidia's AI chips by providing data center services in locations outside China, the Information reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿迪达斯与 Thom Browne 就条纹商标在英国法庭展开争论
item.description: 运动服装巨头阿迪达斯（Adidas）和时装品牌 Thom Browne 周三再次打起了官司，伦敦高等法院就双方争夺条纹商标的最新一轮全球纠纷进行了听证。【原文：Athletic wear giant Adidas and fashion house Thom Browne resumed their legal battle on Wednesday, with London's High Court hearing the latest round of a global dispute focused on their competing striped trademarks.】

item.title: Prologis上调年度核心FFO预期，因需求改善和数据中心实力增强
item.description: 专注于仓储的房地产投资信托基金（REIT）普洛斯（Prologis）周三上调了全年核心运营资金（FFO）预期的下限，原因是数据中心的需求和实力有所改善。【原文：Warehouse-focused real estate investment trust (REIT) Prologis raised the lower end of its full-year forecast for core funds from operations (FFO) on Wednesday, banking on better demand and strength from data centers.】

item.title: Discover 向 Carlyle 和 KKR 出售学生贷款组合，售价高达 108 亿美元
item.description: 发现金融服务公司（Discover Financial Services）周三表示，将以高达 108 亿美元的价格向收购巨头凯雷（Carlyle）和 KKR 出售学生贷款组合。【原文：Discover Financial Services will sell a portfolio of student loans to buyout giants Carlyle and KKR for up to $10.8 billion, the credit card-focused lender said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 6 月单户住宅开工率下降
item.description: 6 月份，美国单户住宅建设进一步下滑，但由于人们对美联储将在 9 月份实施期待已久的降息越来越乐观，未来几个月的建设活动可能会出现反弹。【原文：U.S. single-family homebuilding dropped further in June, but activity is likely to rebound in the months ahead amid growing optimism the Federal Reserve will deliver a long-awaited interest rate cut in September.】

item.title: 苹果公司支持 5000 万美元基金支持湾区经济适用房建设
item.description: 苹果公司正与房地产公司 Sobrato 的慈善部门以及另外两个位于加利福尼亚州的团体合作，发起一项基金，首期投资 5000 万美元，用于支持旧金山湾区的经济适用房项目。【原文：Apple is partnering with the philanthropic arm of real estate firm Sobrato and two other California-based groups to launch a fund with an initial investment of $50 million to support affordable housing projects in the San Francisco Bay Area.】

item.title: 北方信托因手续费收入增加和会计收益而利润大增
item.description: 资产与财富管理公司北方信托（Northern Trust）周三公布的第二季度利润增长了两倍多，这主要得益于较高的手续费收入，以及与 Visa 公司的股票交易带来的 8.784 亿美元的会计收益。【原文：Asset and wealth manager Northern Trust posted a more than two-fold jump in second-quarter profit on Wednesday, thanks to higher fee income and an accounting gain of $878.4 million from a stock exchange deal with Visa .】

item.title: 芯片股因担心美国收紧对华销售限制而暴跌
item.description: 周三收盘前，芯片制造商的股价下跌了4%以上，原因是有报道称可能会加强对主要市场中国的先进技术供应限制，以及共和党总统提名人唐纳德-特朗普对台湾的评论。【原文：Shares of chipmakers fell more than 4% before the bell on Wednesday amid reports of possible tighter restrictions on supply of advanced technology to key market China and comments on Taiwan from Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.】

item.title: 世贸组织称中国工业扶持计划缺乏透明度
item.description: 世界贸易组织周三表示，由于 "整体缺乏透明度"，该组织无法清楚地了解中国对电动汽车或铝和钢铁生产等关键工业部门的财政支持。【原文：The World Trade Organization said on Wednesday that it was unable to get a clear picture of China's financial support for key industrial sectors, such as electric vehicles or aluminium and steel production due to an "overall lack of transparency".】

item.title: 梅赛德斯-奔驰公司与星巴克合作在美国建立快速充电站
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰公司周三表示，该公司已与星巴克合作，在全美 100 多个地点部署其快速充电站。【原文：A Mercedes-Benz unit said on Wednesday it had partnered with Starbucks to deploy its fast-charging stations at more than 100 locations across the United States.】

item.title: 存款成本影响利息收入，美国合众银行调整后利润下降
item.description: 本周三，美国合众银行（U.S. Bancorp）第二季度调整后利润下降约 10%，原因是存款成本上升和贷款需求低迷导致利息收入下降。【原文：U.S. Bancorp's adjusted profit fell about 10% in the second quarter on Wednesday, hurt by a decline in interest income due to higher deposit costs and muted loan demand.】

item.title: 资本市场强劲，公民金融公司利润超出预期
item.description: Citizens Financial 周三公布的第二季度利润超出预期，原因是强劲的资本市场缓解了贷款疲软带来的冲击。【原文：Citizens Financial beat expectations for second-quarter profit on Wednesday, as strong capital markets softened the hit from weaker lending.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：美联储主席威廉姆斯暗示未来数月有必要降息
item.description: 纽约联储主席约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）在周三发表的一篇访谈中表示，美联储正 "越来越接近 "可以开始降息的时刻，但在七月会议之前将缺乏足够的数据来确认通胀率正在可持续地回到2%的水平。【原文：The Federal Reserve is "getting closer" to a point where it can start cutting interest rates but will lack sufficient data before its July meeting to confirm inflation is on a sustainable path back to 2%, New York Fed President John Williams said in an interview published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英镑驶入快车道需要的不仅仅是更高的英国利率
item.description: 英镑周三创下一年来的最高点，原因是全球利率开始下降，投资者争相寻求更丰厚的回报，但策略师们表示，英镑要想保持这种光芒，需要的不仅仅是更高的利率。【原文：The pound hit its highest in a year on Wednesday, driven by investors who are scrambling for juicier returns as global interest rates start to fall, but strategists say it will take more than higher rates for sterling to retain that sparkle.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉大米和玉米产量增加，因为买家向农民贷款供应
item.description: 在委内瑞拉西部波图格萨州，罗伯托-拉蒂尼（Roberto Latini）种植的 300 多公顷（740 英亩）青翠的玉米和水稻在艳阳和蓝天下起伏。【原文：More than 300 hectares (740 acres) of verdant corn and rice planted by Roberto Latini in the western Venezuelan state of Portuguesa undulate under a bright sun and blue sky.】
